net.foxycorndog.jfoxylib

Class Frame

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.foxycorndog.jfoxylib.Frame

  • public class Frame
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that is used to control the Frame used in the game.
    Since:
    Mar 9, 2013 at 3:18:44 AM, v0.1
    Version:
    Mar 9, 2013 at 3:18:44 AM, v0.2
    Author:
    Braden Steffaniak

        Returns whether or not the Frame has been created.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the Frame has been created.

      • create

        public static void create()
        Method to create a default Frame 7/10's the width and height of the screen size.

      • init

        public static void init()

      • create

        public static void create(int width,
          int height)
        Method to create a Frame the specified size.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the Frame to create.
        height - The height of the Frame to create.

      • update

        public static void update()
        Updates the Frame and its Components. Called every frame.

      • getPanel

        public static Panel getPanel()
        Get the main Frame Panel that holds all of the Components in the Frame.
        Returns:
        The main Frame Panel instance.

      • add

        public static boolean add(Component component)
        Add a Component to the Frame. Lets the listeners be active.
        Parameters:
        component - The Component to add.
        Returns:
        Whether it was added successfully or not.

      • remove

        public static boolean remove(Component component)
        Remove a Component from the Frame.
        Parameters:
        component - The Component to remove.
        Returns:
        Whether it was removed successfully or not.

      • setResizable

        public static void setResizable(boolean resizable)
        Set whether the Frame should be resizable.
        Parameters:
        resizable - Whether the Frame should be resizable.

      • isVSyncEnabled

        public static boolean isVSyncEnabled()
        Returns whether the Frame has Vertical Synchronization enabled or not.
        Returns:
        Whether the Frame has Vertical Synchronization enabled or not.

      • setVSyncEnabled

        public static void setVSyncEnabled(boolean vSync)
        Limit the frame rate to the monitors capable speed to reduce the tearing of the frames. Map slow down the performance, but in most cases looks better.
        Parameters:
        vSync - Whether or not to enable or disable vertical synchronization.

      • getFPS

        public static int getFPS()
        Get the amount of frames that the Frame gets per second. Each frame includes the clearing of the screen, calls to the loop and render methods, and other methods too.
        Returns:
        The most recent amount of frames per second.

      • setFPS

        public static void setFPS(int fps)
        Set the value that is used to display the frames per second.
        Parameters:
        fps - The value to set it to.

      • getTargetFPS

        public static int getTargetFPS()
        Get the value that is set for the target FPS. The target FPS is used to create a goal for the Frame to try to reach whenever looping through the main loop. The program tries to accomplish the specified amount of frames per second each second.
        Returns:
        The target frames per second each second.

      • setTargetFPS

        public static void setTargetFPS(int targetFPS)
        Set the value that is set for the target FPS. The target FPS is used to create a goal for the Frame to try to reach whenever looping through the main loop. The program tries to accomplish the specified amount of frames per second each second.
        Parameters:
        targetFPS - The target frames per second each second.

      • getTitle

        public static java.lang.String getTitle()
        Get the title that is displayed in the Title Bar of the Frame.
        Returns:
        The title that is displayed in the Title Bar.

      • setTitle

        public static void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
        Set the title that is displayed in the Title Bar of the Frame.
        Parameters:
        title - The title that is to be displayed in the Title Bar.
